page.title: 12Chain Hill Farm,Wantage (2)
page.content:
At Chain Hill farm pigs are reared. There are 10 boars and 150 sows.The mothers and babies are kept in huts on the Downs. We saw piglets that had been penned in the yard.Some were 3 weeks old,some 6 weeks and others were 11 weeks old.The farmer sells them when they are 3 months old. He showed us the special rolls that he feeds to the sows.They contain oil, protein,fibre, vitamins,molybdenum and selenium.The piglets are given special small pellets. We were allowed to stroke a baby pig and we sat in a modern tractor.
The Lockinge Estate was built up in
